Container.Name: orcpub2-server
Container.Overview:
This is a container for the Orcpub code used on Dungeon Master's Vault. This container requires the use of a Datomic-free server and an nNginx proxy. With the proper configuration of the Nnginx proxy, you can add your own homebrew directly onto the server so that it is accessible to all users. (You must provide this content.)
In order to set this up, some manual work is required. (This is due to my lack of familiarity with setting up docker.) Two additional containers are needed. An Nginx docker and a datomic docker. Though you can use your preferred images, I will only be covering what I use.
Datomic: akiel/datomic-free An xml template is available at: https://github.com/mrcory/Unraiad_Docker_Templates/tree/master/OrcPub
Nginx: jlesage/nginx-proxy-manager (available from the community app) For homebrew content add the below line to the Advanced tab when creating your proxy.
"location /homebrew.orcbrew {root /usr/share/nginx/html/homebrew; }"
You will then need to add your homebrew to wherever you map "/usr/share/nginx/html/homebrew" as a file named "homebrew.orcbrew"
Find my template on Github. https://github.com/mrcory/Unraiad_Docker_Templates
Standalone version of orcpub, as a java jar Converted By Community Applications Always verify this template (and values) against the dockerhub support page for the container
